abstract_summ: The most significant threat to global child health from SARS-CoV-2 is unlikely to be related to COVID 19 in children, but rather the socio-economic consequences of a prolonged pandemic.Infants and young children had relatively more severe illness than older children.Our data show that initial VLs at diagnosis in symptomatic children is comparable to those in adults, and that symptomatic children of all ages shed infectious virus in early acute illness.It should be suspected in all symptomatic children who have undertaken international travel in the last 14 d, all hospitalized children with severe acute respiratory illness, and asymptomatic direct and high-risk contacts of a confirmed case.CONCLUSIONS Pediatricians should consider the potential risks of developing severe illness of infants infected by SARS-CoV-2 and take them seriously.
title_summ: Shedding of infectious SARS-CoV-2 in symptomatic neonates, children and adolescentsThe clinical course of SARS-CoV-2 positive neonatesCoronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Children -Clinical Approach and ManagementCurrent Scenario of COVID-19 in Pediatric Age Group and Physiology of Immune and Thymus responsePediatric Asthma & Coronavirus (COVID-19)-Clinical Presentation in an Asthmatic Child—Case ReportCoronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in adolescents: An update on current clinical and diagnostic characteristics.COVID-19 in Children, Pregnancy and Neonates: A Review of Epidemiologic and Clinical Features.So Far and What We Do NotCOVID-19 in Children:
title_abstract_phrases: Infants and young children had relatively more severe illness than older children.The most significant threat to global child health from SARS-CoV-2 is unlikely to be related to COVID 19 in children, but rather the socio-economic consequences of a prolonged pandemic.The current outbreak of infections with SARS-CoV-2 is defined as Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19).Current Scenario of COVID-19 in Pediatric Age Group and Physiology of Immune and Thymus responseAbstract COVID-19 pandemic caused by SARS-CoV-2, continues to manifest with severe acute respiratory syndrome among the adults, however, it offers a convincing indication of less severity and fatality in pediatric age group (0-18 years).INTRODUCTION Since December 2019, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has spread rapidly around the world and caused more than 487 000 infections and 22 000 deaths worldwide.
